result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and court event: October 12, 2022 - Initial Appearance/Preliminary Hearing. Transcribed by Jennifer Carter
Trial Order signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 10/18/22

10:35 AM Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Darryl D Mire.  Attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case called to address State's motion to disimiss 22CF1122.
Court notes Defense filed a motion to dismiss as well.
State gives background on the motion.
Court notes the transcript of the preliminary hearing in 22CF1122 has not been filed with the court as ordered at the last hearing.
Court orders the transcript must still be filed with the Court.
Arguments by the Defense.
Arguments by the State.
Court denies the Defense's motion to dismiss 22CF1122 based on the speedy trial statute.
Court denies the Defense's motion to dismiss 22CF1122 and 22CF1493 based on double jeopardy.
Court denies the State's motion to set 22CF1493 for trial on 11/29/22 and dismiss 22CF1122.
Court will use the 10/24/22 hearing to address the Defense's objection to the Amended Complaint as there is no motion for joinder from the State.
State is not pursuing the Amended Complaint in 22CF1122.
Court orders 22CF1122 will proceed on  the charges in the original Information, Counts 1-7.
Court cancels the hearing set for 11/24/22.
22CF1122 remains set for jury status hearing on 11/21/22 with the jury trial commencing on 11/29/22.
Defense has entered a speedy trial demand in 22CF1493.
Defense notes the transcript from 9/23/22 has been ordered and expects to file a motion to attack the arraignment in 22CF1493.
Parties agree that the 90 day deadline in 22CF1493 commences with the date of the preliminary hearing on 10/12/22.
Parties agree that the deadline for starting the jury trial in 22CF1493 is 1/20/23.
Jury trial in 22CF1493 expected to last 5 days.  Court will select 2 alternate jurors.  Each side will be entitled to 5 strikes.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Hearing on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:28 AM Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Darryl D Mire.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of amended complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
The State requests not to address bail.
The Court will leave bail as fixed. 

Attorney Galaviz presents arguments as to the Defense's Motion to Dismiss. 
ADA Schmidt presents counter arguments.
Attorney Galaviz presents counter arguments.
ADA Schmidt presents counter arguments.
The Court places its findings on the record.
The Court denies the Defense's Motion to Dismiss.  

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective Shelly Fisher, of the City of Waukesha Police Department/Waukesha County Sheriff's Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Schmidt.
Cross examination by attorney Galaviz.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and requests to dismiss counts 7, 8, 9, & 11 and objects to bind over on all other counts.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 

ADA Schmidt moves to dismiss 22CF1122.
Attorney Galaviz objects to dismissing the case.
The Court will hold the dismissal in abeyance and will leave that up to the Trial Court.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:20 AM Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Darryl D Mire.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of complaint. Atty. Schmidt states amended complaint adds the charges from 22 CF 1122 they will be moving to dismiss case 22 CF 1122 once there is bind over on this case.  Discussion regarding the speedy trial demand.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Atty. Galaviz requests an adjournment of the preliminary hearing.  Court adjourns the preliminary hearing and initial appearance on the amended complaint until 10/12/2022 at 8:15 a.m.

Attorney Galaviz would like to enter a speedy trial demand on 22CF1493.

State filed an amended complaint in 22CF1122.  
Defense acknowledges receipt but objects.
Arguments by the State.
State also filed an amended information in 22CF1122.

Court accepts the amended complaint and amended information while preserving the right for the defendant to challenge them.
State to order the preliminary hearing transcript in 22CF1122.

2:11 PM Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Darryl D Mire. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.
Atty. Gutierrez states the public defender's office has a conflict and is trying to retain counsel for the defendant and requests time limit to remain.  State requests preliminary hearing to be held on 10/5/2022.  Court makes findings.  Court finds that the preliminary hearing will need to be adjourned as counsel has not been appointed by then.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Court extends the time limits for the preliminary hearing to 10/07/2022.  Preliminary hearing will remain as previously scheduled.  Hearing set for 10/5/2022 will remain before Judge Bohren as to the status of the appointment of counsel.  Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing on September 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Darryl D Mire
Current: C/O Waukesha County Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd., Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-26-2022)
Prior: 10913 W Hampton Ave,8, Milwaukee, WI 53218

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim B/Witness A/Witness B/Witness C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key in 22CF1122. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 miles of Victim A/Victim B (from case 22CF1122) listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A/Victim B listed in the Victim Identification Key in 22CF1122.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Court sets cash bail in the amount of $100,000.00.
Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A/Victim B listed in the Victim Identification Key in 22CF1122.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed. 
State notes the victim/witness key in this matter should be identical to the one in 22CF1122 and will file an amended.
